segments.en: Numbered Discourses 4
2. Walking
16. Subtlety
“Mendicants, there are these four kinds of subtlety.
What four?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu rūpasokhummena samannāgato hoti paramena;
segments.en: A mendicant has ultimate subtlety of form.

segments.pli: tena ca rūpasokhummena aññaṃ rūpasokhummaṃ uttaritaraṃ vā paṇītataraṃ vā na samanupassati;
segments.en: They don’t see any other subtlety of form that’s better or finer than that,

segments.pli: tena ca rūpasokhummena aññaṃ rūpasokhummaṃ uttaritaraṃ vā paṇītataraṃ vā na pattheti.
segments.en: nor do they aim for it.
A mendicant has ultimate subtlety of feeling.

segments.pli: tena ca vedanāsokhummena aññaṃ vedanāsokhummaṃ uttaritaraṃ vā paṇītataraṃ vā na samanupassati;
segments.en: They don’t see any other subtlety of feeling that’s better or finer than that,

segments.pli: tena ca vedanāsokhummena aññaṃ vedanāsokhummaṃ uttaritaraṃ vā paṇītataraṃ vā na pattheti.
segments.en: nor do they aim for it.
A mendicant has ultimate subtlety of perception.

segments.pli: tena ca saññāsokhummena aññaṃ saññāsokhummaṃ uttaritaraṃ vā paṇītataraṃ vā na samanupassati;
segments.en: They don’t see any other subtlety of perception that’s better or finer than that,

segments.pli: tena ca saññāsokhummena aññaṃ saññāsokhummaṃ uttaritaraṃ vā paṇītataraṃ vā na pattheti.
segments.en: nor do they aim for it.
A mendicant has ultimate subtlety of choices.

segments.pli: tena ca saṅkhārasokhummena aññaṃ saṅkhārasokhummaṃ uttaritaraṃ vā paṇītataraṃ vā na samanupassati;
segments.en: They don’t see any other subtlety of choices that’s better or finer than that,

segments.pli: tena ca saṅkhārasokhummena aññaṃ saṅkhārasokhummaṃ uttaritaraṃ vā paṇītataraṃ vā na pattheti.
segments.en: nor do they aim for it.
These are the four kinds of subtlety.
Knowing the subtlety of form,
the cause of feelings,
where perception comes from,
and where it ends;
and knowing choices as other,
as suffering and not-self,
that mendicant sees rightly,
peaceful, in love with the state of peace.
They bear their final body,
having vanquished Māra and his mount.”

sections.title: “Mendicants, there are these four kinds of subtlety.

suttaplex.blurb: Subtlety of form, feeling, perception, and choices.
